title: [pytorch] [feature request] Entropy function
body_html:
Exists in SciPy: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.stats.entropy.html, in PyTorch can be something like:

def entropy(p, dim = -1, keepdim = None):
   return -torch.where(p > 0, p * p.log(), p.new([0.0])).sum(dim = dim, keepdim = keepdim) # can be a scalar, when PyTorch.supports it

I agree it is more specialized, but is still useful sometimes.

One other place it may be put in is torch.distributions[.functional]

body:
Exists in SciPy: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.stats.entropy.html, in PyTorch can be something like:

```python
def entropy(p, dim = -1, keepdim = None):
   return -torch.where(p > 0, p * p.log(), p.new([0.0])).sum(dim = dim, keepdim = keepdim) # can be a scalar, when PyTorch.supports it
```

I agree it is more specialized, but is still useful sometimes.

One other place it may be put in is `torch.distributions[.functional]`
